intro: Euphrasia wilczekii, commonly known as Wilczek's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy habitats and has hairy, linear leaves. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Euphrasia wilczekii is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
